title.rendered: How to Recover Deleted Songs on Android

content.rendered:
Are you a music lover that just deleted a song off of your phone? If you download Dumpster, we’ll be able to restore that audio file instantly, and for free!

This article is for musicians, singers, songwriters, instrumentalists, avid music listeners, Youtubers, TikTokers, and everyone in-between!

How to Restore Song Recordings on Dumpster

If you aren’t able to find your missing audio file in the trash or in the music or video platforms you use, your best back up option is Dumpster, a file restoration app on Google Play.

Dumpster has the ability to restore most deleted audio files. You can view the entire list of supported files here. The app supports the most popular audio file types: MP3, MP4, WMA, AAC, M4A, & FLAC. Here’s how the app works:

Once Dumpster is installed on your Android device, it will start restoring all of your previously deleted files. It’s important to know that the app will scan your device for all deleted files, whether or not it’s an audio file. Once your content is detected you’ll notice that your Recycle Bin will begin populating with those old deleted files.

All you need to do next, is select the file(s) you wish to undelete. Almost instantaneously, the song recording will appear back to normal on your smartphone or tablet.

If you’re an avid music listener, content creator, musician, or a singer-songwriter ー we recommend you download Dumpster to prevent accidentally deleting other audio files, or even photos, videos, and other documents.

If Music is Your Life – Back Up Your Audio Files with Dumpster!
